revised_title: Anatomy and Function of the Gizzards of Grazing Birds
tldr: The author examines the gizzards of grazing birds, such as geese and swans, and compares their structure and function to that of non-grazing birds like turkeys. The gizzards of grazing birds have unique adaptations for grinding and breaking down tough plant material, similar to the teeth of ruminating animals. This study provides insight into the digestive systems of birds that primarily consume grass and other vegetation.
